brief_description: A comparative cohort study examining replication and disease pathogenesis associated with low-pathogenic H5N1, H5N2, or H5N3 avian influenza virus (AIV) infection of chickens and ducks was performed.
brief_title: Replication and pathogenesis associated with H5N1 H5N2 and H5N3 low-pathogenic avian influenza virus infection in chickens and ducks
condition_studied: Replication and pathogenesis associated with H5N1, H5N2 and H5N3 low-pathogenic avian influenza virus
description: A comparative cohort study examining replication and disease pathogenesis associated with low-pathogenic H5N1, H5N2, or H5N3 avian influenza virus (AIV) infection of chickens and ducks was performed.
endpoints: virus replication, induction of a serological response, and disease pathogenesis, hemagglutinin and neuraminidase (NA) gene sequences of the isolates were determined
objectives: A comparative study examining replication and disease pathogenesis associated with low-pathogenic H5N1, H5N2, or H5N3 avian influenza virus (AIV) infection of chickens and ducks was performed.
official_title: Replication and pathogenesis associated with H5N1, H5N2 and H5N3 low-pathogenic avian influenza virus infection in chickens and ducks

personnel.organization: College of Veterinary Medicine, University of Georgia

pubmed.title: Replication and pathogenesis associated with H5N1, H5N2, and H5N3 low-pathogenic avian influenza virus infection in chickens and ducks.

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
